SENT.plain: We report the case of a 54-year-old woman with aplastic anemia, who developed transient pulmonary infiltrates following intravenous infusion of rabbit antithymocyte globulin (ATG) for 3 days
There was no other explanation than the infusion of ATG for the infiltrates
Rechallenge with ATG induced the recurrence of opacities on the chest radiograph
Although rarely involved with only 4 previous reports, ATG should be included in the list of drugs capable of inducing pulmonary infiltrates
